summary: This is a Palm Beach Police Department Evidence/Property Tracking Report from August 26, 2006, documenting the chain of custody for a digital voice recorder seized as evidence in case 1-05-001079 (sexual battery). The report lists Jeffrey Epstein as the suspect and shows the recorder was released to investigators on November 15, 2005.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: Listed as the suspect/arrestee in the sexual battery case (1-05-001079). His address (358 El Brillo Way) and birth date (January 20, 1953) are recorded.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.context: Listed as an 'OTHER PERSON' associated with the evidence/case. The initial property entry notes the voice recorder was received 'W/RODRIGUEZ & ALESSI'.

persons.name: Juan P. Alessi
persons.context: Initially listed as the owner/name for the digital voice recorder evidence. Later also listed as an 'OTHER PERSON' in the name information section.

connections.description: Both are named in the same police evidence report for case 1-05-001079. Alessi was initially listed as the owner of the voice recorder evidence related to the investigation of Epstein.
Both are named in the same police evidence report. Rodriguez is listed as an 'OTHER PERSON' and was present with Alessi when the voice recorder evidence was initially handled.
The evidence report notes the digital voice recorder was received 'W/RODRIGUEZ & ALESSI', indicating they were together when the property was initially logged.

events.title: Voice Recorder Seized as Evidence
events.description: A digital voice recorder was seized as evidence in case 1-05-001079, a sexual battery investigation.

events.title: Evidence Released to Investigator
events.description: The digital voice recorder evidence was released to an investigator from the Detective Bureau.

keyFacts: A digital voice recorder was seized as evidence in Palm Beach Police case 1-05-001079, investigated as a sexual battery.
Jeffrey Epstein is explicitly listed as the 'SUSPECT/ARRESTEE/SEARCHED' in this case, with his full name, address, and date of birth recorded.
The evidence tracking report shows the voice recorder was initially received from or in the presence of Juan P. Alessi and Alfredo Rodriguez.
The document is subject to a protective order, indicating sensitive or restricted information.
The evidence was released to an investigator on November 15, 2005, for investigative purposes.
